alert.note: Alert for Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 11:52AM EST until December 27 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Transylvania. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1147 AM EST, Streamgauge reports indicated ongoing flooding of low-lying areas throughout the upper French Broad Valley which includes the French Broad River proper, as well as select tributaries such as the Davidson and Little Rivers. Continue to remain wary of flooding near these locations this afternoon as excessive runoff from earlier heavy rain continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Looking Glass, Gorges State Park, Lake Toxaway, Dupont State Forest, Connestee, Balsam Grove, Cedar Mountain and Penrose. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
